Instruction: Prepare the starter the night before by combining 1/2 teaspoon of active dry yeast with 1 cup of warm water in a medium-sized non-metal mixing bowl. Add 1 1/2 cups of bread flour, mix well, cover, and allow it to sit overnight at room temperature.

The night before, prepare a starter by combining 1/2 teaspoon active dry yeast with 1 cup warm water in a medium-sized non-metal mixing bowl. Mix in 1 1/2 cups bread flour. Cover and let it sit overnight at room temperature.
Place the dough in a lightly oiled large bowl, cover it with a damp cloth, and let it rise in a warm location until it has doubled in size, which typically takes about 1 hour.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease two 9x5-inch loaf pans.

Punch down the dough and transfer it to a lightly floured surface. Cut the dough into 2 equal portions and shape into loaves. Place the loaves in the greased pans. Cover with a damp cloth and allow them to rise until doubled in size, approximately 45 minutes.
Bake in the oven until the top turns golden brown and the bottom of the loaf sounds hollow when tapped, usually around 30 minutes.
